snippet: Most institutions are pursuing alternative investments, which have been underperforming a simple mix of stocks and bonds in recent years.
abstract: James B Stewart Common Sense column notes that university endowments, which have shifted in recent years to complex investments like hedge funds, venture capital and private equity funds, are performing far worse than simple stock and bond mixes; holds that the rush away from traditional models is having a negative impact on many institutions.
lead_paragraph: Most institutions are pursuing alternative investments, which have been underperforming a simple mix of stocks and bonds in recent years.

headline.print_headline: University Endowments Face a Hard Landing
headline.seo: A Hard Landing for University Endowments
headline.main: University Endowments Face a Hard Landing
